channel.title: A couple Problems
channel.description:
First i get this when i compile [URL=http://img43.imageshack.us/i/compiler2332.png/][IMG]http://img43.imageshack.us/img43/6470/compiler2332.png[/img][/URL] then when i run my server i get his... [URL=http://img80.imageshack.us/i/compiler22332.png/][IMG]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/9306/compiler22332.png[/img][/URL]
Thanks for the HELP... :)

item.title: A couple Problems
item.dc:creator: @Fluoxetine Fluoxetine
item.description:
@Fluoxetine wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Fluoxetine link=topic=443570.msg3257179#msg3257179 date=1278204128]
if u read the errors properly, they say Spirts NOT SPIRITS, u need to go into spirits.java and change it all so it says spirit, not spirt

basically, its trying to load from spirts instead of spirits which im guessing thats where u want it to be loading from

rep++ if this helped u pls
[/quote]
First off. It was a typo.
They are called SPRITES.
just cause Galkon/Bluur are retards doesn’t mean you correct.
Also, there are no ‘spirts’, ‘spirits’, or ‘sprites’ java files.

In 317s, sprites are loaded through Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class, unless the method was renamed/moved to a different class.[/quote]

well how could it possibly be a typo when its from a screensaver??? IT IS TRYING TO READ FROM SPIRT…

Read full topic

item.title: A couple Problems
item.dc:creator: @Fluoxetine Fluoxetine
item.description:
@Fluoxetine wrote:

if u read the errors properly, they say Spirts NOT SPIRITS, u need to go into spirits.java and change it all so it says spirit, not spirt

basically, its trying to load from spirts instead of spirits which im guessing thats where u want it to be loading from

rep++ if this helped u pls

Read full topic

item.title: A couple Problems
item.dc:creator: @Axiom_Owner Axiom Owner
item.description:
@Axiom_Owner wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]There’s a Read Error.
Which means, the directory of each image, ‘sprite,’ is blank, or right-protected, or doesn’t exist.

The images might also be incorrect format, so try looking in to the images’ directory.[/quote]
what if i delete all the spirites and replace them with another of that same client spirits?

Read full topic
